13/09/2021.headline: Left behind by Australia, Afghan interpreter finds refuge in the UK
13/09/2021.description: After being rejected by Australia, a former ADF interpreter finds refuge in the UK after spending days at Kabul airport with his family, trying to escape the Taliban regime.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

13/09/2021.headline: UN chief warns Afghans face 'most perilous hour' as he pleads for international aid
13/09/2021.description: A United Nations-hosted international aid conference for Afghanistan raised more than A$1.4 billion.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

13/09/2021.headline: Indonesian officials arrest suspected leader of group linked to Bali bombings
13/09/2021.description: The suspected leader of an al-Qaeda-linked group blamed for a string of bombings has been arrested in Indonesia.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

13/09/2021.headline: US Secretary of State defends Afghanistan withdrawal amid criticism from Congress
13/09/2021.description: Mr Blinken is facing two days of grilling by congressional committees - the first opportunity for lawmakers to directly challenge President Joe Biden's administration over his end to the 20-year war that brought a swift victory to the Taliban.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

13/09/2021.headline: Migrant advocates concerned government welfare changes will create 'two-class system'
13/09/2021.description: If passed, the bill would impose a consistent four-year waiting period on new migrants from next year before they can access certain welfare payments.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

13/09/2021.headline: NSW man with Nazi flag and state map in bedroom arrested over plan to make 3D gun
13/09/2021.description: An alleged neo-Nazi whose bedroom wall is adorned with the German Reich flag has been arrested by counter-terrorism police in central NSW over a 3D gun crime.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

13/09/2021.headline: The main challenges facing Lebanon's new government
13/09/2021.description: Lebanon ended a 13-month wait for a new government last week with the unveiling of a cabinet facing the daunting task of rescuing the country from economic meltdown. Here's what awaits it going forward.
13/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

14/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,127 new local COVID-19 cases and two more deaths
14/09/2021.description: NSW Health's Dr Jeremy McAnulty said 78.8 per cent of the state's residents aged over 16 have had one vaccine dose, while 46.5 per cent are fully vaccinated.
14/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

14/09/2021.headline: Victoria records 445 new local COVID-19 cases and two more deaths
14/09/2021.description: Victoria has recorded two deaths and 445 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases, with 3799 active cases in the state.
14/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

14/09/2021.headline: ACT's lockdown extended by four weeks as 22 new COVID-19 cases recorded
14/09/2021.description: The ACT has recorded 22 new COVID-19 cases, with the lockdown extended for another month.
14/09/2021.author: Sam Phillips

14/09/2021.headline: A man in his 20s has died in Victoria after contracting COVID-19
14/09/2021.description: The Melbourne man has become the youngest death in Victoria's current COVID-19 outbreak.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: ACT's lockdown extended by four weeks as 22 new COVID-19 cases are recorded
14/09/2021.description: The ACT has recorded 22 new COVID-19 cases, with the lockdown extended for another month.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Tu Le says people are 'furious' about Labor's Kristina Keneally selection 'debacle'
14/09/2021.description: It comes as questions are asked about whether ethnic diversity quotas should be adopted in Australian politics.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Afghan women are sharing photos of colourful clothing in protest of the Taliban
14/09/2021.description: It comes after photos emerged over the weekend of women covered head-to-toe in black waving Taliban flags at a university in Kabul.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Quade Cooper among those to benefit from changes to Australian citizenship rules
14/09/2021.description: The changes, announced on Tuesday, will see eligible visa holders considered among the “most talented prospective Australians” given greater flexibility around meeting residency requirements.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: New pop-up mental health clinics to open across Melbourne and regional Victoria
14/09/2021.description: Victoria will spend an extra $22 million on mental health, including $13 million on pop-up clinics across the state.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Joe Biden to talk climate change with Scott Morrison at upcoming White House meeting
14/09/2021.description: Analysts say action on climate change could present as a potential point of friction during the meeting.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Final days of Aboriginal woman Ms Wynne before police restraint heard at inquest
14/09/2021.description: A coronial inquest into the death of Ms Wynne, 26, has heard she escaped from a mental health facility before losing consciousness while being restrained by police several days later.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Ageism is affecting Australian adults of many ages, new research finds
14/09/2021.description: A report from the Australian Human Rights Commission has found ageism exists across the nation - even if we are not consciously aware of it.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Prince Andrew to challenge jurisdiction of US court in sex assault lawsuit
14/09/2021.description: Queen Elizabeth II's second son plans to challenge a US court's jurisdiction over a civil lawsuit by a woman who accused him of sexually assaulting and battering her two decades ago.
14/09/2021.author: None found

14/09/2021.headline: Once you've had COVID-19 should you still get vaccinated or qualify for 'freedoms'?
14/09/2021.description: More and more people in Australia are now developing natural immunity to COVID-19 after contracting the disease, but what that means for their ongoing protection - and the country’s opening up - remains in question.
14/09/2021.author: Anthony Galloway

14/09/2021.headline: New Zealand MƒÅori Party renews push to change country's official name to Aotearoa
14/09/2021.description: The party initially raised the idea in 2017 and it was also part of its policy platform at the 2020 general election.
14/09/2021.author: Anthony Galloway

14/09/2021.headline: Government looking at ways to get more Pacific workers on Australian farms
14/09/2021.description: It comes as changes are announced to two schemes that bring workers to regional Australia from Pacific nations.
14/09/2021.author: Anthony Galloway

15/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,259 new local COVID-19 cases and 12 deaths as state hits vaccine milestone
15/09/2021.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian has also announced curfews in western and southwestern Sydney's 12 local government areas of concern are being lifted.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Regional Victorian city of Ballarat to enter lockdown with Shepparton set to emerge
15/09/2021.description: It comes after Victoria recorded 423 new coronavirus cases and two deaths on Wednesday, as the number of total active infections climbed above 4,000.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison seeking advice on Christian Porter’s blind trust legal fees
15/09/2021.description: It's been confirmed the Prime Minister has discussed the matter with Mr Porter, after the latter revealed bills in his defamation case against the ABC were partly funded through a blind trust.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: ACT records 13 new coronavirus cases - eight infectious in the community
15/09/2021.description: Of the new cases, eight are household contacts of previous infections and five were in quarantine the whole time.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Craig Kelly has been hit with a cease and desist letter over his spam texts
15/09/2021.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration has accused the NSW MP of breaching copyright and misleading the public about adverse reactions to vaccines.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: WA police officers questioned over pursuit of Aboriginal woman Ms Wynne at inquest
15/09/2021.description: WA police officers have been asked to explain why they chased a 26-year-old Aboriginal woman, entered her residence and handcuffed her, despite not suspecting her of committing any specific crime. Ms Wynne died five days later in hospital.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Australia's ARIA Awards will have gender-neutral categories this year
15/09/2021.description: Organisers say the gender-neutral award categories will embrace and recognise non-binary artists.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez defends wearing 'tax the rich' dress at Met Gala
15/09/2021.description: Critics had said wearing the dress to the lavish event was hypocritical.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Everything you need to know about the upcoming Canadian election
15/09/2021.description: Canada is voting in a hotly contested election next week, called two years early by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. Here's a look at the political state of play and what issues are expected to decide the outcome.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: UK plans COVID-19 booster shots for the vulnerable to cope with 'bumpy' winter
15/09/2021.description: Older and more vulnerable Britons will be targeted in a COVID-19 vaccine booster program.
15/09/2021.author: None found

15/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison 'seeking advice' on Christian Porter's blind trust legal fees
15/09/2021.description: It's been confirmed the Prime Minister has also discussed the matter with Mr Porter, after the latter revealed bills in his defamation case against the ABC were partly funded through a blind trust.
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: Calls to ensure voluntary assisted dying rights are understood by all
15/09/2021.description: As Queensland looks set to make voluntary assisted dying legal this week, there are calls to ensure culturally and linguistically diverse communities understand their rights
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: Police restraint footage played at inquest into death of Aboriginal woman Ms Wynne
15/09/2021.description: The vision was played on Wednesday during the third day of the inquest into the Noongar-Yamatji woman's death.
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: This year's ARIA Awards will have gender-neutral categories
15/09/2021.description: Organisers say the gender-neutral award categories will embrace and recognise non-binary artists.
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: North Korea has launched another round of ballistic missiles, South Korea says
15/09/2021.description: The reported launch came after North Korea said it successfully tested a new long-range cruise missile over the weekend.
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: Nine Hong Kong pro-democracy activists jailed for joining banned Tiananmen vigil
15/09/2021.description: Last week, police arrested organisers of the vigils under national security legislation imposed by Beijing last year.
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: Australia issued fresh emissions warning in new OECD report
15/09/2021.description: The federal government has responded to the report by repeating its commitment to a technology-driven approach to reaching net zero as soon as possible, preferably by 2050.
15/09/2021.author: Daniel Cherny

15/09/2021.headline: Australia to acquire nuclear-powered submarines as part of new US-UK defence deal
15/09/2021.description: Australian, US and UK leaders made the major security announcement on Thursday morning.
15/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Lismore and Albury to return to lockdown as NSW records 1,351 new COVID-19 cases
16/09/2021.description: The regional LGAs of Lismore and Albury will go into a seven-day lockdown from 6pm on Thursday after testing showed new cases in those areas.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Victoria to allow more outdoor gatherings as state reports 514 new COVID-19 cases
16/09/2021.description: The 514 new COVID-19 cases is Victoria's highest daily tally since the peak of its 2020 second wave.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Tamil family from Biloela set to be offered new three-month bridging visas
16/09/2021.description: The Murugappan family has been living in Perth since June following the medical evacuation from Christmas Island of the youngest daughter with a blood infection.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Why Australia's new defence pact with the US and Britain is so significant
16/09/2021.description: ANALYSIS: While ditching a $90 billion deal with the French is a massive diplomatic move by Australia, the real underlying consequence of the new US-UK pact surrounds our highly conflicted relationship with China.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Christian Porter's cabinet position up in the air as Scott Morrison considers advice
16/09/2021.description: Labor leader Anthony Albanese says there is now such a "stench" around Mr Porter that "all that is missing is a cloud of blowflies".
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Man accused of raping Brittany Higgins at Parliament House pleads not guilty
16/09/2021.description: The lawyer for a man charged with raping then-Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins has entered a plea of not guilty on his behalf in the ACT Magistrates Court.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: ACT records another 15 locally acquired coronavirus infections
16/09/2021.description: Of the new cases, 11 are linked and five had been in quarantine for their whole infectious period.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Victorian religious schools to be banned from sacking LGBTIQ+ staff under new reforms
16/09/2021.description: The announcement has been roundly welcomed by unions and LGBTIQ+ advocacy groups.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: South and North Korea fire missiles hours apart, raising prospect of arms race
16/09/2021.description: The South's submarine-launched missile test came hours after it said the nuclear-armed North fired two ballistic missiles into the sea.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: US court orders re-sentencing of Australian woman Justine Damond Ruszczyk's killer
16/09/2021.description: The Minnesota Supreme Court has reversed the third-degree murder conviction of a former police officer who fatally shot Australian Justine Damond Ruszczyk in 2017.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Pearson

16/09/2021.headline: Gladys Berejiklian defends Brad Hazzard over comment on lawbreakers from 'other backgrounds'
16/09/2021.description: The NSW premier says her health minister was not suggesting people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds were more likely to break the rules.
16/09/2021.author: Jordan Baker

16/09/2021.headline: Lismore and Albury back in lockdown after NSW records 1,351 new COVID-19 cases
16/09/2021.description: The regional LGAs of Lismore and Albury went into a seven-day lockdown at 6pm on Thursday.
16/09/2021.author: Jordan Baker

16/09/2021.headline: Queensland becomes fifth Australian state to legalise voluntary assisted dying
16/09/2021.description: Queensland has become the fifth state to legalise euthanasia after the government's Voluntary Assisted Dying Bill passed parliament.
16/09/2021.author: Jordan Baker

16/09/2021.headline: Australia's new 'forever partnership' and nuclear submarine deal splits opinion
16/09/2021.description: While Scott Morrison has hailed the pact as an important move for Australia's interests, it's also been criticised as "a stab in the back" that'll see "floating Chernobyls in the heart of our major cities".
16/09/2021.author: Jordan Baker

16/09/2021.headline: Fadi became an Australian citizen and a father at the same time
16/09/2021.description: Friday marks the 20th anniversary of the first Australian Citizenship Day, and despite the COVID-19 lockdowns about 7,000 people will become new citizens around the country thanks to online ceremonies.
16/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

16/09/2021.headline: Controversial facial recognition technology could be the key to opening Australia's borders
16/09/2021.description: Returning Australians and permanent residents could soon be quarantining in the comfort of their own homes - but there are concerns the largely untested software could misidentify people from some backgrounds
16/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

16/09/2021.headline: Italy makes COVID-19 health pass mandatory for all workers
16/09/2021.description: Any worker who fails to present a valid health certificate will be suspended on no pay, but cannot be sacked, and those who ignore the decree and go to work regardless will face a fine.
16/09/2021.author: Michaela Whitbourn

17/09/2021.headline: NSW announces home quarantine trial as it posts 1,284 new local COVID-19 cases and 12 deaths
17/09/2021.description: It comes as it's confirmed the Glen Innes and Hilltops areas in regional NSW are going into a week-long lockdown.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: Victoria records 510 COVID-19 cases as state hits 70 per cent first vaccine target
17/09/2021.description: Despite 95 per cent of new cases being in Melbourne's north and western suburbs, Health Minister Martin Foley is concerned about rising cases in the southeast.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: Stranded Afghans granted temporary visas by Australia in fear of being forgotten
17/09/2021.description: There are concerns more than 150 people granted visas by Australia but still stuck in Afghanistan won’t be able to leave the country before their documents expire.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: New Zealand extends pause on travel bubble with Australia until November
17/09/2021.description: The announcement came as New Zealand reported 11 new COVID-19 cases, all in Auckland.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: 'Sadistic' COVID-19 restrictions in Sydney's west made residents 'feel like criminals'
17/09/2021.description: An inquiry into the NSW government's handling of the pandemic has been told people in west and southwest Sydney have been made to feel like criminals in their own homes.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: ACT records 30 new COVID-19 cases with almost half infectious in the community
17/09/2021.description: Of the latest cases, at least 14 were in the community for some of their infectious period and 12 in quarantine the whole time.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: Peter Dutton hits back at China's 'outbursts' following US nuclear submarine deal
17/09/2021.description: A historic pact to share nuclear-powered submarine technology was revealed on Thursday, which China said "gravely undermines regional peace and stability".
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: Thousands of migrants converge under Texas bridge in squalid makeshift camp
17/09/2021.description: The temporary camp has grown with staggering speed in recent days following a massive surge in migrants fleeing Haiti.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: Sydney gang rapist Mohammed Skaf to be released from prison next month
17/09/2021.description: Sydney gang rapist Mohammed Skaf will leave prison no later than 8 October after being granted parole with strict conditions.
17/09/2021.author: Linda Morris

17/09/2021.headline: Australians stranded overseas welcome further moves towards home quarantine
17/09/2021.description: Select travellers will next month start quarantining at home in NSW as part of a growing national push to replace reliance on repurposed hotels.
17/09/2021.author: Michaela Whitbourn

17/09/2021.headline: Australia's strawberry farmers are crying out for more seasonal workers
17/09/2021.description: As the federal government plans to fast track more seasonal workers from overseas onto Australian farms amid COVID-19 travel bans, for many it's already too late with growers having to destroy up to half of their spring crops.
17/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

17/09/2021.headline: World on 'catastrophic' climate path of 2.7C warming, UN warns
17/09/2021.description: The world is headed towards a hotter future unless governments make more ambitious pledges to cut greenhouse emissions, UN chief Antonio Guterres warns.
17/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: Police arrest 235 people after violent Melbourne anti-lockdown rally
18/09/2021.description: Clashes erupted between officers and protesters on Saturday after hundreds flocked to an anti-lockdown rally in Melbourne in defiance of the public health orders.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: Sydney anti-lockdown protest fizzles out as police arrest 32 people
18/09/2021.description: Police said their operation worked like a "well-oiled machine" to prevent large-scale protest activity.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: NSW reports 1,331 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths
18/09/2021.description: More than half of the state's residents aged 16 years and over are now fully vaccinated.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: Victoria sets new record with 535 COVID-19 cases, one death
18/09/2021.description: Of the 535 new local COVID-19 infections, 62 have been linked to known cases.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: Australia urged to repair ties with 'blindsided' France after submarine deal fallout
18/09/2021.description: France says Australia's handling of the decision to scrap a $90 billion submarine contract has resulted in a "breach of confidence" between the two nations.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: Australia opposes China bid to join TPP trade deal
18/09/2021.description: For China's formal application to join the TPP trade deal to be successful, it will need unanimous support from all current members of the regional pact.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: US admits Kabul drone strike killed civilians in 'tragic mistake'
18/09/2021.description: The US has retreated from its defence of a drone strike in Afghanistan last month, saying only civilians were killed in the attack not IS-Kmilitants.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: First crew of non-professional astronauts recount first 48 hours in space
18/09/2021.description: Strumming a ukulele and schmoozing with Tom Cruise and Elon Musk are among the ways the first all-civilian astronaut crew have spent their time in orbit.
18/09/2021.author: Peter Ryan

18/09/2021.headline: Recalled French ambassador says next steps being considered after Australia's 'breach of trust'
18/09/2021.description: France's ambassador to Australia told SBS French the decision to scrap the $90 billion submarine goes beyond a breach of a contract, describing it as "treason in the making".
18/09/2021.author: Angus Thompson

18/09/2021.headline: Abandoned overseas: The mental health toll of Australia's closed borders on its citizens
18/09/2021.description: Some Australians stranded abroad during the COVID-19 pandemic are still struggling despite finally returning home after long delays, while thousands more remain stuck.
18/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Christian Porter resigns from government frontbench over anonymous donation
19/09/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says he has accepted Christian Porter's resignation from the federal cabinet, adding it is the "appropriate course of action".
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: What you need to know about Victoria's new roadmap out of lockdown
19/09/2021.description: The first of the restrictions are expected to be lifted as early as 26 September, when at least 80 per cent of eligible Victorians are due to have had their first dose of a coronavirus vaccine.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: NSW to relax hotspot restrictions as state reports 1,083 new COVID-19 cases
19/09/2021.description: The same rules and restrictions will now be applied to all residents of Greater Sydney, regardless of their hotspot status. But the authorised worker and worker permit rules will remain.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison says he doesn't regret scrapping French submarine deal
19/09/2021.description: Defending the decision to scrap the $90 billion French submarine deal, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said Australia needs to protect its strategic interests.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Victoria's roadmap out of lockdown outlined as state records 507 COVID-19 cases
19/09/2021.description: Geelong, the Surf Coast Shire and Mitchell Shire enters a seven-day lockdown from midnight, as the premier outlines the roadmap out of lockdown.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Some Afghan girls return to school, others face anxious wait
19/09/2021.description: Female high school students in Afghanistan still have no idea when they can resume their studies.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Victoria's police union asks why riot squad was not deployed at Melbourne anti-lockdown rally
19/09/2021.description: Victoria Police will be pressed by the union on why the riot squad was not sent to help uniformed officers at a violent rally in Richmond on Saturday.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: ACT poised to start vaccinating under-16s as outbreak expands to 618 cases
19/09/2021.description: The ACT has recorded 17 new coronavirus cases a day before 12-to 15-year-olds can get vaccinated at mass inoculation hubs in the territory.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Doctors warn against hasty COVID-19 reopening
19/09/2021.description: The Australian Medical Association has warned against being too hasty in easing restrictions, calling for a cautious approach even at high vaccination rates.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Relatives of Afghan family killed in US strike want face-to-face apology
19/09/2021.description: The admission by the US that a drone strike had mistakenly killed 10 civilians near Kabul airport has sparked calls for compensation and an apology.
19/09/2021.author: Ashleigh McMillan

19/09/2021.headline: Australian doctors warn against hasty COVID-19 reopening
19/09/2021.description: The Australian Medical Association has warned against being too hasty in easing restrictions, calling for a cautious approach even at high vaccination rates.
19/09/2021.author: None found

20/09/2021.headline: Gladys Berejiklian warns against complacency as NSW records 935 new local COVID-19 cases
20/09/2021.description: New South Wales has recorded 935 cases of community transmission, a significant drop on recent figures, which have been consistently over 1,000 per day.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: Victoria to receive 300,000 Moderna vaccines as 567 new COVID-19 cases recorded
20/09/2021.description: About 300,000 Moderna vaccine appointments will soon be made available to Victorians, after the state recorded 567 new COVID-19 cases and one death.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: Grace Tame criticises handling of Christian Porter's resignation
20/09/2021.description: It comes as Mr Porter continues to face calls for transparency around the source of anonymous donations from a trust fund used to help cover his legal fees.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: Basketballer Tai Webster cut from New Zealand Breakers over COVID-19 vaccine refusal
20/09/2021.description: New Zealand Breakers player Tai Webster has followed older brother Corey out the door at the Auckland-based NBL club because of his COVID-19 vaccination stance.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases as Pfizer bookings open for children aged 12 to 15
20/09/2021.description: The ACT has reported seven new coronavirus infections as the territory takes a swing at the federal government over vaccine supply.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: New Zealand to scale back Auckland lockdown after 22 new COVID-19 cases recorded
20/09/2021.description: New Zealand health officials reported 22 new community cases of COVID-19 on Monday, including three outside Auckland.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: Boxer Manny Pacquiao to run for president of the Philippines in 2022
20/09/2021.description: The champion Filipino boxer has announced he will run for presidency next year but he could face a formidable rival in the current president's daughter.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: Joe Biden asks for talks with Emmanuel Macron amid French submarine row
20/09/2021.description: It comes as North Korea condemns the AUKUS pact, saying it will retaliate if it sees its security threatened.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: More than 3,000 migrants moved from Texas bridge by US authorities
20/09/2021.description: There are reports of migrants seen back in Haiti following a concerted effort by US authorities to fly them away from a Texas bridge where a makeshift camp has been set up.
20/09/2021.author: Emma Koehn

20/09/2021.headline: Melbourne construction industry shut down following violence at vaccine protest
20/09/2021.description: CFMEU officials say Monday's protesters were not actually union members, but "neo-Nazi's and right-wing extremists" who hijacked the event.
20/09/2021.author: Laura Chung

20/09/2021.headline: Construction union condemns 'neo-Nazis' at Melbourne vaccine mandate protest
20/09/2021.description: The CFMEU says the protest outside its Melbourne office was "heavily infiltrated by neo-Nazis and other right-wing extremist groups".
20/09/2021.author: Laura Chung

20/09/2021.headline: Cowra enters lockdown after NSW records 935 new local COVID-19 cases
20/09/2021.description: Cowra in central western NSW entered lockdown on Monday evening after a schoolboy there was diagnosed with COVID-19 and traces of the virus were found in wastewater.
20/09/2021.author: Laura Chung

20/09/2021.headline: Wealthy nations to fall short in pledged climate finance to the most vulnerable
20/09/2021.description: New analysis from Oxfam has found that poorer countries are set to miss out on as much as $104 billion in funding over six years to adapt to climate change.
20/09/2021.author: Laura Chung

20/09/2021.headline: Pfizer says its COVID-19 vaccine is safe and effective for children aged five to 11
20/09/2021.description: Pfizer and BioNTech say they will seek regulatory approval shortly in various countries.
20/09/2021.author: John Silvester

20/09/2021.headline: The US is lifting air travel bans in November for the fully-vaccinated
20/09/2021.description: Currently only US citizens, residents and foreigners with special visas are allowed to enter the United States from most European countries.
20/09/2021.author: John Silvester

20/09/2021.headline: US border guards criticised for tactics rounding up Haitian migrants on horseback
20/09/2021.description: Some on social media commented that the image of fleeing black men chased by white officers on horseback had echoes of the historical injustices suffered by black people in the United States.
20/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Dozens arrested at Melbourne vaccine protest as police warn 'ongoing investigations' to track more attendees
21/09/2021.description: It comes after the state government announced the construction industry would be shut down from Tuesday for two weeks in metropolitan Melbourne, City of Ballarat, City of Greater Geelong, Surf Coast Shire and Mitchell Shire.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Areas of northern NSW re-enter lockdown as state reports 1,022 new COVID-19 cases
21/09/2021.description: It comes amid the announcement of a new 'friends bubble' for children.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Victoria reports 603 new local coronavirus cases and one further death
21/09/2021.description: It's the first time Victoria has surpassed the 600-case mark for positive cases in one day since the start of the current outbreak.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Liberal MP Dave Sharma urges government to back more ambitious 2035 emissions reduction target
21/09/2021.description: The Liberal backbencher has conceded he doesn't "underestimate" the political difficulty around trying to gain support for a more ambitious medium-term target.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Justin Trudeau wins third term as Canada's prime minister in tight election race
21/09/2021.description: Justin Trudeau's Canadian Liberal party will continue to govern in minority after an early election gamble aimed at capitalising on its handling of the pandemic failed to pay off.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: ACT boosts mental health funding as it records 16 new local COVID-19 cases
21/09/2021.description: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr announced an additional $14 million to boost immediate and longer-term mental health services.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Damage control over submarine deal continues as Scott Morrison arrives in New York
21/09/2021.description: The Prime Minister's visit to the United States for talks comes against the backdrop of a diplomatic rift with France.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Texas doctor sued after revealing he broke the state's controversial new abortion ban
21/09/2021.description: A doctor in Texas who performed an abortion after the country's most restrictive legislation was passed in the state is being sued, testing the validity of the new laws.
21/09/2021.author: John Silvester

21/09/2021.headline: Dozens of protesters arrested in Melbourne as Daniel Andrews condemns 'terrible behaviour'
21/09/2021.description: It comes after the Victorian government announced the construction industry would be shut down for two weeks from Tuesday in the parts of the state currently in lockdown.
21/09/2021.author: Broede Carmody

21/09/2021.headline: Experts say the far-right and anti-vaxxers are infiltrating industry protests
21/09/2021.description: Experts say anti-vaxxers and the far-right have infiltrated protests against mandatory vaccines for construction workers. But they’ve stopped short of claiming these individuals ‘orchestrated’ the event.
21/09/2021.author: Broede Carmody

21/09/2021.headline: Millions of dollars in fines for breaching Australia's COVID rules haven't been paid
21/09/2021.description: Data collated by SBS News shows millions of dollars in fines for breaches of public health orders in New South Wales and Victoria remain unpaid, with legal services saying the system needs to be revamped and have compassion for those struggling to pay up.
21/09/2021.author: Broede Carmody

21/09/2021.headline: Greg Hunt asks Pfizer to seek approval for COVID-19 vaccine use in children aged five to 11
21/09/2021.description: Australian children aged between five and 11 could get a COVID-19 vaccine jab as early as this year depending on approval, the nation’s Chief Nursing Officer says.
21/09/2021.author: Broede Carmody

21/09/2021.headline: Justin Trudeau wins third term as Canada's prime minister but falls short of securing majority
21/09/2021.description: Justin Trudeau's Canadian Liberal party will continue to govern in minority after an early election gamble aimed at capitalising on its handling of the pandemic failed to pay off.
21/09/2021.author: Broede Carmody

21/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison’s talks with Joe Biden will dominate this week - but don’t miss the detail
21/09/2021.description: ANALYSIS: While the Prime Minister's meetings with the US President will likely hog the headlines during his overseas visit this week, the importance of smoothing over relations with other countries over climate and defence concerns can't be overlooked.
21/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

21/09/2021.headline: Global coronavirus vaccine inequity is 'an obscenity', UN chief says
21/09/2021.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says while the world "passed the science test" it is "getting an F in ethics".
21/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

21/09/2021.headline: German election: The migrants having their say despite now calling Australia home
21/09/2021.description: Germany will go to the polls on Sunday 26 September, with Chancellor Angela Merkel stepping down after 16 years and action on climate change a key election issue. Here's how some German migrants in Australia will vote.
21/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: 'A disgrace': Melbourne protesters condemned for gathering at Shrine of Remembrance
22/09/2021.description: While some attendees have been there to protest mandatory vaccinations for the construction industry, authorities say the demonstrators are not all union members or construction workers.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: What we know so far about the Melbourne protests
22/09/2021.description: For the past three days, we’ve seen a city awash with hi-vis vests, riots and a heavy police presence across Melbourne’s CBD. Here’s what we know so far about the Melbourne protests.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: Magnitude 5.9 earthquake hits Victoria, causing ripples felt in Canberra and Tasmania
22/09/2021.description: Reports indicate people experienced the impacts of the earthquake as far away as Sydney, Tasmania and Canberra.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: Albury and Lismore lockdowns to end as NSW reports 1,035 local COVID-19 cases
22/09/2021.description: Eighty-three per cent of the eligible NSW population has had their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, while 54.2 per cent are double vaccinated.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: Coronavirus vaccines mandated for Victorian school and childcare staff
22/09/2021.description: Teachers and childcare workers in Victoria will have to have their first COVID-19 vaccine dose by 18 October or have a booking within a week of that date.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison defends Australia's action on climate change as he meets Joe Biden
22/09/2021.description: Scott Morrison has again defended Australia's track record on climate action after coming under sustained pressure from allies to do more to reduce emissions.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: The ACT reports 17 new local COVID-19 cases
22/09/2021.description: Just one of the new COVID-19 cases in the ACT was in quarantine for their entire infectious period.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: Brazilian health minister tests positive for COVID-19 after attending UN meeting
22/09/2021.description: The minister is the second member of President Jair Bolsonaro's entourage to test positive for the virus since arriving in New York for the United Nations General Assembly.
22/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

22/09/2021.headline: More than 200 protesters arrested after violence at Melbourne's Shrine of Remembrance
22/09/2021.description: A tense stand-off between protesters and police at the state's national war memorial on Wednesday ended in violent scenes and arrests.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: Victoria hit by magnitude 5.9 earthquake, but escapes with minor damage
22/09/2021.description: Six aftershocks have since been registered, between 2.4 and 4.1 on the Richter scale, and further tremors are expected in coming days and possibly months.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: Dan Tehan says nations must set aside 'self-interest' to fight vaccine inequity
22/09/2021.description: Australia's trade minister has described ensuring the fair global distribution of vaccines as a crucial test for the World Trade Organization.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: 'Batsman' replaced with gender-neutral 'batter' in landmark update to Laws of Cricket
22/09/2021.description: The body recognised as the sole authority on cricket's laws has made a major shift that will see gender-neutral terms such as “batter” and “batters” used rather than “batsman” and “batsmen”.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: Albury and Lismore leave lockdown as NSW reports 1,035 local COVID-19 cases
22/09/2021.description: Eighty-three per cent of the eligible NSW population has had their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, while 54.2 per cent are double vaccinated.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: COVID-positive truck driver from NSW sparks virus concern in WA and SA
22/09/2021.description: A truck driver who travelled through both South Australia and Western Australia has sparked a COVID-19 scare after testing positive for the virus upon his return to New South Wales.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: The ACT has reported 17 new local coronavirus cases
22/09/2021.description: Just one of the new COVID-19 cases in the ACT was in quarantine for their entire infectious period.
22/09/2021.author: Adam Carey

22/09/2021.headline: South Australia has unanimously voted to ban spit hoods
22/09/2021.description: The state’s upper house has backed Fella’s Bill, named after Aboriginal man Wayne Fella Morrison who died after being made to wear a spit hood by Adelaide prison guards five years ago.
22/09/2021.author: None found

22/09/2021.headline: International travel will be back 'by Christmas at the latest', government says
22/09/2021.description: Dan Tehan says he believes international borders will be open in time for Christmas.
22/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Three members of Tamil family from Biloela granted 12-month bridging visas
23/09/2021.description: The Murugappan family's youngest daughter, four-year-old Tharnicaa, has not been granted a visa, meaning they are unable to return to the Queensland town.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Former Melbourne school principal Malka Leifer to stand trial on 70 child sex abuse charges
23/09/2021.description: The 55-year-old pleaded not guilty to the charges at the end of a committal hearing in Melbourne on Thursday.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Victoria shatters its COVID-19 case record as residents stranded in NSW allowed to return
23/09/2021.description: Wednesday's caseload marks the highest daily increase in cases for the state since the start of the pandemic, surpassing the 725 record set in August 2020.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: 'Abusive' protesters force closure of Melbourne vaccine centre as police brace for more unrest
23/09/2021.description: A Melbourne vaccination centre and a health clinic have shut down after it says staff were verbally and physically abused by people in a mob that has disrupted the CBD for days.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Greens to introduce legislation to extend Australian visas for people stuck overseas
23/09/2021.description: The Greens estimate there are thousands of people stuck overseas with temporary Australian visas that are running out or have expired.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Penny Wong warns Australia's new submarine deal must not come at expense of aid efforts
23/09/2021.description: Labor's foreign affairs spokeswoman has cautioned against military development undermining investment efforts in the Indo-Pacific.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Australian children as young as seven are having suicidal thoughts after years in Syrian camps
23/09/2021.description: Save the Children says the only thing preventing the federal government from repatriating Australian children stuck in refugee camps in north-east Syria is political will.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,063 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths as vaccine rates continue climbing
23/09/2021.description: It’s also been announced the lockdowns in Glen Innes and Orange will lift at midnight Thursday, though stay-at-home orders for the Hilltops area will be extended for another week.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Ten aftershocks recorded following historic Victorian earthquake
23/09/2021.description: A man in Melbourne's southeast was injured during Wednesday's record earthquake, as Victorian authorities confirm the state has now had 10 aftershocks.
23/09/2021.author: None found

23/09/2021.headline: Melbourne protester in hospital with COVID-19 as police make more than 90 arrests
23/09/2021.description: A person who attended a protest in Melbourne on Wednesday has tested positive for COVID-19 and is in hospital.
23/09/2021.author: Fergus Hunter

23/09/2021.headline: Call for a ‘national voice’ to improve health care for multicultural communities
23/09/2021.description: The Federation of Ethnic Communities Councils of Australia is forming a new body to provide advice on accessing health care for people from diverse backgrounds.
23/09/2021.author: Fergus Hunter

23/09/2021.headline: Former Melbourne principal Malka Leifer to stand trial on 70 child sex abuse charges
23/09/2021.description: The 55-year-old pleaded not guilty to the charges at the end of a committal hearing in Melbourne on Thursday.
23/09/2021.author: Fergus Hunter

24/09/2021.headline: ‘Dream come true’: Orphans evacuated to Australia in perilous journey through Afghanistan
24/09/2021.description: While 10 orphans were able to be evacuated out of Afghanistan, dozens of others were left behind.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Australia signs new agreement with Nauru to continue offshore processing of asylum seekers
24/09/2021.description: Both governments on Friday signed a memorandum of understanding to "establish an enduring regional processing capability" on the South Pacific island nation, drawing criticism from advocates.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,043 new COVID-19 cases and 11 deaths as premier hails vaccine rates
24/09/2021.description: Of the 11 new deaths, ten people were unvaccinated.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Anti-lockdown protester among 733 new local COVID-19 cases in Victoria
24/09/2021.description: Health Minister Martin Foley has also announced the state will receive 32,000 doses of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine from the federal government next week.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Josh Frydenberg says it's in Australia's interests to support global climate targets
24/09/2021.description: However, Scott Morrison insists the government has made no commitment to officially adopt a target of net zero emissions by 2050.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Calls for inquiry into the influence of the far-right in Victoria after violent protests
24/09/2021.description: The Victorian Greens will call for an inquiry into the far-right and links to anti-vaccination conspiracy groups when state parliament resumes in a fortnight.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Vaccinated international students to return to NSW by the end of the year
24/09/2021.description: International students fully vaccinated with a TGA-approved jab will start returning to NSW by the end of the year.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Australia and India strike deal on low-emissions technology
24/09/2021.description: Clean energy was among the topics discussed by the two leaders in their first face-to-face meeting since the pandemic started.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: ACT records 19 new COVID-19 cases amid outbreak at aged care facility
24/09/2021.description: Among the new cases are two fully vaccinated aged care workers at Calvary Haydon Retirement Community.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: Senate president Scott Ryan quits federal parliament, brings forward retirement
24/09/2021.description: Scott Ryan's decision to resign from federal parliament before the next election creates a casual vacancy for the Victorian branch of the Liberal Party.
24/09/2021.author: None found

24/09/2021.headline: More than half of Australians aged 16 and over are fully vaccinated against COVID-19
24/09/2021.description: Australia has reached 50.15 per cent double-dose vaccination coverage for all people aged 16 and above, while almost 75 per cent have received at least one jab.
24/09/2021.author: Damien Ractliffe

24/09/2021.headline: More than 200 arrested in Melbourne after fifth day of protests
24/09/2021.description: It comes as the state records 733 new COVID-19 cases, including a man who attended Wednesday's anti-lockdown protest, and another death.
24/09/2021.author: Damien Ractliffe

24/09/2021.headline: WA imposes tougher COVID-19 restrictions on Victorians, records new case
24/09/2021.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan says a woman has tested positive for COVID-19 after unlawfully flying in from NSW, but there's no wider risk to the community.
24/09/2021.author: Damien Ractliffe

24/09/2021.headline: Grace Tame and the woman who painted her Archibald portrait
24/09/2021.description: Among the famous faces in the 2021 Archibald Prize, which begins a regional tour next month, is Australian of the Year Grace Tame. The story behind the portrait is one of two women speaking out for survivors of sexual abuse.
24/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: 'I've got work to do': Scott Morrison says there won't be an early election this year
25/09/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has ruled out calling an early election in an interview with SBS News in Washington.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Australia will help regional neighbours combat climate change with technology: PM
25/09/2021.description: Despite pressure, Prime Minister Scott Morrison did not make any commitments towards a 2050 net zero emissions goal.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,007 new cases of COVID-19, 11 new deaths
25/09/2021.description: NSW recorded 1,007 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19 on Saturday,
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Victoria sets new record with 847 COVID-19 cases, one death
25/09/2021.description: Victoria has recorded 847 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases as the state registers a 55 per cent increase in COVID-19 hospitalisations over the last week.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Two Canadians released by China after three years in detention, Justin Trudeau says
25/09/2021.description: The Two Michaels, as they have become known in Canada, had been arrested and imprisoned on espionage charges in the days after Canada detained Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Melbourne anti-lockdown protesters scatter after police make multiple arrests
25/09/2021.description: A large police contingent was deployed in Melbourne as anti-lockdown protesters gathered for another rally in defiance of COVID-19 rules.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Australian Indians slam Queensland premier's 'sarcastic' comment
25/09/2021.description: A spokesperson for the premier said she was simply highlighting the problem of approving international travel anywhere, if the federal government didn't list the countries Australians were allowed to travel to.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Australia's immigration centre vaccination rates 'appalling'
25/09/2021.description: Vaccination rates in immigration detention recently lagged about 20 percentage points behind the general population, a freedom of information request reveals.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: Climate change galvanises voters to rally ahead of German election amid worldwide protests
25/09/2021.description: As the restrictions of the pandemic ebb away, climate action protesters are planning to get back on the streets in Germany and around the world.
25/09/2021.author: Heath Gilmore

25/09/2021.headline: As the Angela Merkel era ends, what legacy does she leave?
25/09/2021.description: The German election takes place this weekend, with Angela Merkel’s long reign as chancellor nearing its end.
25/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: A Taliban ambassador in Canberra? We're not thinking about it, says PM
26/09/2021.description: Australia is not contemplating a Taliban representative occupying the Afghan embassy in Canberra, Prime Minister Scott Morrison says.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Anthony Albanese confirms a Labor government would continue AUKUS alliance
26/09/2021.description: Labor leader Anthony Albanese has thrown his support behind the AUKUS security partnership signed by Prime Minister Scott Morrison, saying it would "certainly continue" if he wins the next election
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: NSW records 961 new cases of COVID-19 and nine deaths
26/09/2021.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian says it is safe for NSW residents to begin planning for Christmas within the state.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Victoria records 779 COVID-19 cases as second anti-lockdown protester tests positive
26/09/2021.description: Meanwhile lockdown restrictions will ease for Geelong and the Surf Coast Shire, but not for the Mitchell Shire.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: German voters undecided on Angela Merkel's successor
26/09/2021.description: The vote to decide Germany's new leader after 16 years under Chancellor Angela Merkel is set to go to the wire and may take months to resolve.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Swiss vote on same-sex marriage in referendum
26/09/2021.description: A proposed law allowing same-sex couples to marry and adopt children is going to the vote in one of the last Western European nations to still ban same-sex marriage.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Victoria names its first Indigenous LGBTIQ+ commissioner
26/09/2021.description: Australia's first young, Indigenous and queer commissioner is calling for better services and safer spaces for the First Nations LGBTIQ+ community.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou home after Canada prisoner swap
26/09/2021.description: A senior executive of Chinese firm Huawei has returned home after a high-stakes prisoner swap brought to an end a three-year standoff with the US and Canada.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Music stars urge action on climate change, vaccines in 24-hour global event
26/09/2021.description: Spanning seven continents, Global Citizen Live forms part of a wider initiative to address vaccine equity, extreme poverty and climate change.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Sydney to host Matildas matches in October
26/09/2021.description: Sydney will play host to a two-match Matildas series against Brazil in October after Football Australia's biosecurity plan was given the tick of approval.
26/09/2021.author: Jake Niall

26/09/2021.headline: Some 27,000 Australians missed heart checks during the COVID-19 pandemic
26/09/2021.description: Some 27,000 heart health checks have been missed due to COVID-19, meaning nearly 350 heart attacks, strokes or heart-related deaths won't be prevented.
26/09/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

27/09/2021.headline: Children born today to see '24 times more' climate-induced disasters than their grandparents
27/09/2021.description: A new report from Save the Children has found that kids born in 2020 will on average experience up to 24 times as many climate-induced extreme weather events as someone born in the 1960s.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: NSW roadmap out of lockdown revealed as state records 787 new COVID-19 cases
27/09/2021.description: The state also reported 12 deaths in the 24 hours to 8pm Sunday, taking the toll for the current outbreak to 309.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Victoria announces grants to speed up COVID-19 vaccine rollout in hard-hit areas
27/09/2021.description: Victoria has recorded 705 new COVID-19 cases and one further death, as the government announces grants for general practitioners and pharmacies to speed up the vaccination rollout.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Commission warns against opening up before everyone with a disability is vaccinated
27/09/2021.description: The disability commission has recommended the federal government ensure people with disabilities and care workers are fully vaccinated before Australia opens up
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison still isn't sure if he'll go to COP26 climate talks in Glasgow
27/09/2021.description: The COP26 summit is considered the most significant meeting on climate change since the signing of the Paris Agreement.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: ACT announces path out of lockdown as 19 new COVID-19 cases recorded
27/09/2021.description: The news came on the same day the ACT recorded its first death from COVID-19 during the current outbreak - a man in his 90s who was in palliative care at an aged care facility in Canberra's north
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Germany's centre-left narrowly wins election against Angela Merkel's party
27/09/2021.description: Germany's Social Democrats are claiming a "clear mandate" to lead from voters, with election results pointing towards a three-way alliance.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Prominent Australians back call for more action to uphold 'moral duty' to Afghans
27/09/2021.description: High profile names including Australian of the Year Grace Tame and former Olympian and politician Nova Peris are among those to support the push in an open letter.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Switzerland has voted overwhelmingly to legalise same-sex marriage
27/09/2021.description: Results from the Swiss federal chancellery show 64.1 per cent of voters were in favour of same-sex marriage in a nationwide referendum on Sunday.
27/09/2021.author: Toby Crockford

27/09/2021.headline: Paralympian shares frustrations over vaccine rollout for people with disabilities
27/09/2021.description: The disability commission has handed down a draft report finding federal government failures are slowing the rollout in the disability community.
27/09/2021.author: Anna Patty

27/09/2021.headline: At least one dead in strong earthquake on Greek island of Crete
27/09/2021.description: A strong earthquake struck the Greek island of Crete early Monday, killing a man who was working in a church that collapsed.
27/09/2021.author: Anna Patty

27/09/2021.headline: Legal experts criticise national cabinet secrecy bid as 'bizarre' and 'disrespectful'
27/09/2021.description: The federal government is attempting to shield the deliberations of national cabinet meetings from freedom of information laws.
27/09/2021.author: Anna Patty

27/09/2021.headline: Panic buying leaves petrol pumps dry across the UK amid trucker shortage
27/09/2021.description: Up to 90 per cent of petrol stations have run dry across major British cities after panic buying deepened a supply chain crisis triggered by a shortage of truckers.
27/09/2021.author: Anna Patty

27/09/2021.headline: R. Kelly found guilty on all counts in sex trafficking trial
27/09/2021.description: R. Kelly has been convicted in his sex trafficking trial after decades of allegations about sexual misconduct with minors.

11/10/2021.description: Twenty-five of the new infections are linked to known cases or existing outbreaks.
11/10/2021.author: Nick Bonyhady

11/10/2021.headline: More than 100,000 Afghans apply for Australian humanitarian visas
11/10/2021.description: The soaring demand for humanitarian visas to come to Australia highlights the “absolute horror” of the situation in Afghanistan, refugee advocates say.
11/10/2021.author: Mary Ward

11/10/2021.headline: Voluntary assisted dying bill to be introduced to NSW parliament his week
11/10/2021.description: A dozen NSW Labor MPs have become co-sponsors of voluntary assisted dying legislation, while the state's premier says he wants a conscience vote on the bill.
11/10/2021.author: Mary Ward

11/10/2021.headline: Record rainfall leads to unseasonable flooding in northern China
11/10/2021.description: Nearly 200,000 hectares of crops have been lost and 17,000 buildings destroyed, with concerns about energy supply for the rest of the country as Shanxi province is one of China's top coal-producing regions.
11/10/2021.author: Mary Ward

11/10/2021.headline: Police officers claim Yamatji woman ‘moved’ knife before fatal shot
11/10/2021.description: First Class Constable Dillon McLean told a WA murder trial Yamatji woman JC "moved the knife at her side" before being fatally shot
11/10/2021.author: Mary Ward

12/10/2021.headline: Afghan-Australians fear families in danger will be rejected for humanitarian visas
12/10/2021.description: There are calls for Australia to increase its Afghanistan refugee intake to 20,000, amid fears tens of thousands of Afghans at risk of persecution stand to be rejected.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: Queensland backs net zero by 2050 as pressure mounts on Scott Morrison
12/10/2021.description: Queensland will officially back a target of net zero emissions by 2050, Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has confirmed.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: Lack of Auslan interpreters at all NSW press conferences slammed as 'selective accessibility'
12/10/2021.description: Deaf and hard of hearing advocates have criticised new NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet for failing to provide Auslan interpreters at his recent press conferences.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: Victoria to recruit overseas healthcare workers to help with COVID-19 outbreak
12/10/2021.description: Victorian health authorities are "cautiously optimistic" after the state recorded a dip in daily coronavirus infections to 1,466, down from a record 1,965 reported on Sunday.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: 'Australia has lost a giant': Holocaust survivor Eddie Jaku dies aged 101
12/10/2021.description: Tributes are flowing for Holocaust survivor Eddie Jaku OAM, a stalwart of Sydney's Jewish community and self-described "happiest man on Earth".
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: ‘Life or death’: People with a disability fear reopening as COVID lockdowns end
12/10/2021.description: Disability advocates say NSW should have held off on easing COVID-19 restrictions until vaccination rates for those with a disability caught up with the rest of the state.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: New mental health strategy for children to place cultural needs ‘front and centre’
12/10/2021.description: There are concerns up to half of all adult mental health problems emerge before the age of 14 but there is a lack of professional help available for children in distress.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: Lego pledges to remove 'gender bias' and 'harmful stereotypes' from its toys
12/10/2021.description: Lego currently has distinct product lines aimed at girls, and has pledged to make its marketing and products gender-neutral and "accessible to all".
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: Prince Charles encourages Scott Morrison to attend COP26 climate summit
12/10/2021.description: Prince Charles says it is important for world leaders, including Prime Minister Scott Morrison, to attend a global climate summit in Glasgow.
12/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

12/10/2021.headline: G20 leaders agree to work together to avoid Afghan humanitarian disaster
12/10/2021.description: Group of 20 leaders have agreed at a virtual summit to work together to avoid economic and humanitarian crises in Afghanistan, sparked by the Taliban's return to power.
12/10/2021.author: None found

12/10/2021.headline: Australian-made rover to be sent to the moon under new NASA deal
12/10/2021.description: An Australian lunar rover could land on the moon within five years under a push to help establish a human presence on the earth's only natural satellite.
12/10/2021.author: None found

12/10/2021.headline: Lack of Auslan interpreters at NSW press conferences slammed
12/10/2021.description: Deaf and hard of hearing advocates have criticised new NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet for failing to provide Auslan interpreters at his recent press conferences.
12/10/2021.author: None found

12/10/2021.headline: PNG and Fiji were both facing catastrophes. Why has only one vaccine rollout surged?
12/10/2021.description: ANALYSIS: Why have two Pacific countries, which share Melanesian cultural connections, handled their vaccine rollouts so differentl
12/10/2021.author: None found

12/10/2021.headline: I'm not an Australian citizen - should I be booking international flights?
12/10/2021.description: Australian citizens and permanent residents will soon be able to realise the dream of reuniting with family and friends, but heartbroken temporary residents will have longer to wait and some are now weighing up whether to book tentative flights for themselves or loved ones in case the rules change.
12/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

12/10/2021.headline: Lack of climate action could put 70,000 Australian jobs at risk, report warns
12/10/2021.description: A new Climate Council report has warned Australia's lack of action to cut emissions could put a combined 70,000 jobs at risk in NSW and Queensland.
12/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

12/10/2021.headline: G20 leaders pledge to work together to avoid Afghan humanitarian disaster
12/10/2021.description: Group of 20 leaders have agreed at a virtual summit to work together to avoid economic and humanitarian crises in Afghanistan, sparked by the Taliban's return to power.
12/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: Pfizer takes step towards under-12 COVID-19 vaccine in Australia
13/10/2021.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration has signed off on the first step of the process to allow Pfizer COVID-19 vaccinations for children aged five to 1
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: Why a proposed law to use secret evidence to deport migrants has rights groups concerned
13/10/2021.description: Rights groups and migrant advocates are concerned the federal government's proposed law could have "catastrophic consequences" for migrants facing potential visa cancellations.
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: Female abuse victims disbelieved and ignored, disability royal commission hears
13/10/2021.description: Women with a disability make up about 20 per cent of the total Australian population, but nearly half of all domestic violence victims, the royal commission has heard.
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: Migrant workers face poor conditions and underpayment on Australian farms, inquiry hears
13/10/2021.description: A Senate inquiry has heard more evidence of appalling pay and conditions for migrant workers on Australian farms, including a Fijian worker who died of a heart attack.
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: ‘COVID almost killed me’: Teen delivers vaccination plea
13/10/2021.description: A Year 11 student who spent two weeks in intensive care has urged people to get vaccinated, as Victoria recorded another 1,571 local COVID-19 cases and a record 13 deaths.
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: SA could become the second Australian jurisdiction to criminalise stealthing
13/10/2021.description: It follows the Australian Capital Territory passing legislation outlawing the practice last week.
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: NSW government confirms shift away from coal with $3 billion hydrogen plan
13/10/2021.description: The NSW government says the strategy will seek to "drive deep decarbonisation" as the state aims to halve its carbon emissions by 2030.
13/10/2021.author: Cameron Myles

13/10/2021.headline: Could Australia see a migration boom after the COVID-19 pandemic?
13/10/2021.description: As Australia rebuilds its economy after more than 18 months of COVID-19, a suggested influx of two million migrants over five years could be “a watershed in our history”
13/10/2021.author: None found

13/10/2021.headline: 'What they see is hatred': Social media platforms told to better combat anti-Semitism
13/10/2021.description: An international conference in Sweden says anti-Semitism is being repackaged and disseminated to young people on Instagram and TikTok but tech companies are "completely failing to address the issue".
13/10/2021.author: None found

13/10/2021.headline: 'There is no deal': Nationals undecided on net zero target as federal cabinet meets
13/10/2021.description: Senior members of the Nationals continue to warn that no deal has been reached to sign off on Australia formally committing to a net zero emissions target by 2050.
13/10/2021.author: None found

13/10/2021.headline: Migration boost needed to remedy major skilled labour shortfalls, report finds
13/10/2021.description: Infrastructure Australia says it anticipates job shortages could rise to 105,000 by mid-2023, as the government attempts to deliver on a $218 billion infrastructure agenda.
13/10/2021.author: None found

13/10/2021.headline: What these flood victims want to hear from world leaders at COP26
13/10/2021.description: July's fatal floods across western Europe sparked calls for tougher action to combat climate change, but not all survivors are convinced of the cause.
13/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Indigenous health leader concerned over COVID-19 vaccination gap as nation reopens
14/10/2021.description: Pat Turner also expressed frustration about a lack of progress from states to develop specific contingency plans for managing COVID-19 outbreaks within First Nations communities.
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Australia urged to extend AstraZeneca vaccine production to support Pacific nations
14/10/2021.description: Reverend Tim Costello wants Australia to make and send millions more doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to poorer countries.
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Voluntary assisted dying could be legal in NSW by the end of the year
14/10/2021.description: A bill to legalise voluntary assisted dying in NSW has been formally introduced to NSW Parliament
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Embattled Labor MP Anthony Byrne resigns from powerful committee amid Victorian inquiry
14/10/2021.description: Under-pressure Labor MP Anthony Byrne has left his post as the deputy chair and member of the Parliamentary Joint Committee on Intelligence and Security.
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Here’s how a group of Melbourne Muslim women is boosting vaccination in their community
14/10/2021.description: The SistaHub group is opening pop-up COVID-19 vaccination clinics and tackling faith-based misinformation to lift immunisation rates in their community.
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Scientists hit with trolling and death threats for discussing COVID-19, survey finds
14/10/2021.description: Some scientists are more reluctant to comment on COVID-19 with one in five reporting death threats, threats of physical or sexual violence after speaking about the pandemic.
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Australia, China urged to ease tensions
14/10/2021.description: Australia and China should start to thaw their frosty relations behind closed doors "like adults", says Fortescue Metals Group chairman Andrew Forres
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: Lockdowns across Australia drive loss of 138,000 jobs in September
14/10/2021.description: The Australian Bureau of Statistics says a further 138,000 jobs were lost in September due to the lockdowns in NSW, Victoria and the ACT.
14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: These young Australians have an urgent message for Scott Morrison ahead of COP26
14/10/2021.description: As the global climate conference nears, SBS News speaks to three Australian students who are skipping school on Friday to demand better climate policies from the federal government.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: ACT's COVID-19 lockdown comes to an end
14/10/2021.description: After nine weeks, the ACT's lockdown has lifted as the state approaches 75 per cent double-dose vaccine coverage.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Afghan evacuees to Australia on temporary visas given pathway to permanent protection
14/10/2021.description: Scores of Afghans who were granted emergency temporary visas during the evacuation process out of Kabul are being told they can apply to stay in Australia permanently, despite their visa conditions stating otherwise.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: One million view NSW COVID-19 vaccine mandate case
14/10/2021.description: A test case on NSW vaccine mandates has been viewed more than one million times on YouTube, according to data from the NSW Supreme Court.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Army tanks and troops deployed to quell Lebanon's worst street violence in years
14/10/2021.description: At least six people are dead and at least 32 wounded in the violence.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Norway attack 'likely an act of terror'
14/10/2021.description: Norwegian police say a 37-year-old suspect has acknowledged killing five people in a bow and arrow attack.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Australia's public hospitals in crisis, AMA report says
14/10/2021.description: An Australian Medical Association report says public hospitals are in a crisis which needs to be addressed by a new funding formula.
14/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: British Foreign Office responds after High Commissioner to Australia criticised over climate 'lectures'
15/10/2021.description: In an interview with SBS News last week, British High Commissioner Vicki Treadell urged the Morrison government to set a more ambitious 2030 emissions reduction target.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Parents to be classified as ‘immediate family’ for travel to Australia, Scott Morrison confirms
15/10/2021.description: The rule change will allow parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents to return to states and territories that have reached 80 per cent full vaccination targets.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Kristina Keneally calls for post-pandemic overhaul of Australia's migration system
15/10/2021.description: Labor’s Home Affairs spokesperson said a "historic" rise in temporary migration had turned a “successful model of migration on its head” and taken Australia’s migration program in the “wrong direction”.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison confirms he'll attend COP26 climate talks in Glasgow
15/10/2021.description: The international climate talks are widely considered to be the most crucial meeting of their kind since the signing of the Paris Agreement in 2015.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Southern Tasmania to go into snap COVID-19 lockdown tonight
15/10/2021.description: Premier Peter Gutwein blamed the snap lockdown on a 31-year-old COVID-positive man not co-operating with authoritie
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: NSW's international border call may delay domestic travel return
15/10/2021.description: The end to quarantine for international travellers in NSW could delay the resumption of domestic travel ahead of the holiday season.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: School students demand climate action at protests across Australia
15/10/2021.description: The end to quarantine for international travellers in NSW could delay the resumption of domestic travel ahead of the holiday season.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Victoria to scrap quarantine for fully vaccinated NSW residents amid 2,179 COVID-19 tally
15/10/2021.description: NSW residents who are fully vaccinated will be able to enter Victoria without needing to undergo quarantine upon arrival.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: How to add your COVID-19 vaccine certificate to the Service NSW app
15/10/2021.description: The COVID-19 digital vaccination certificate can now be integrated with the Service NSW app, simplifying the check-in process in NSW.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: At least 41 people killed by suicide blasts at mosque in Afghan city of Kandahar
15/10/2021.description: It comes just a week after a suicide attack on worshippers at a mosque in the northern city of Kunduz.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: British Conservative MP David Amess stabbed to death at meeting with constituents
15/10/2021.description: The MP from Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party was stabbed to death in a church by a man who walked into a meeting with voters from his electoral district.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Southern Tasmania enters snap three-day coronavirus lockdown
15/10/2021.description: Premier Peter Gutwein blamed the snap lockdown on a 31-year-old COVID-positive man not co-operating with authorities.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: International airfares tipped to increase as demand from Australian travellers soars
15/10/2021.description: Airfare costs on some popular routes could soar due to pent-up demand and pandemic-constrained supply, but should stabilise in the second half of 2022, experts say.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Parents to be classified as 'immediate family' for travel to Australia
15/10/2021.description: The rule change will allow parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents to return to states and territories that have reached 80 per cent full vaccination targets.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Thousands of school students demand climate action at protests across Australia
15/10/2021.description: The latest School Strike 4 Climate rallies come two weeks before the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Glasgow.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Statue of Indigenous woman replaces Columbus monument in Mexico City
