25/11/2021.description: The estimated timeframe for the search has now been extended to six weeks instead of the three weeks initially envisioned.
25/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Kylie Moore-Gilbert says it's her 'duty' to speak out for 'forgotten' political prisoners
26/11/2021.description: EXCLUSIVE: A year since she returned to Australia after spending two years in an Iranian prison, Dr Kylie Moore-Gilbert speaks to SBS News about campaigning for other political prisoners.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Australia 'prepared' for new COVID-19 variant as other nations impose travel bans to contain risk
26/11/2021.description: The UK and Israel have imposed travel restrictions to contain any risk from the new COVID-19 variant found in South Africa as the Australian government says it is well prepared and is closely monitoring the situation.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Royal commission into veteran suicides hears of hope for 'fundamental change'
26/11/2021.description: On the opening day of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide, veterans and families have spoken of the need for "fundamental change".
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Solomons police fire warning shots to disperse protesters, as Australian peacekeepers arrive
26/11/2021.description: An Australian peacekeeping mission has landed in Honiara to help quell civil unrest in the Solomon Islands.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Push to diversify Australia's international student cohort under new government plan
26/11/2021.description: The federal government says its 10-year strategy for international education will help meet skill shortages and create new opportunities for "a more sustainable and diverse sector."
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: 'We were keeping an eye on them': PM confirms China spy ship outside Australian waters
26/11/2021.description: A Chinese spy ship was off Australia's coast in August and was shadowed by HMAS Supply, the federal government and the Department of Defence have confirme
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: EU looks to halt flights from southern Africa amid new COVID-19 variant fears
26/11/2021.description: The European Commission will propose stopping flights from southern Africa in a bid to contain the risk arising from a new COVID-19 variant, with other countries also tightening travel restrictions.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Pat Cummins takes the reins as new cricket Test captain
26/11/2021.description: Pat Cummins has been confirmed as Australia's new Test captain, with the paceman to take on a collaborative approach with new deputy Steve Smit
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: What you need to know about Omicron, the new COVID-19 'variant of concern'
26/11/2021.description: As the world reels over the discovery of a new COVID-19 'variant of concern', here is what we currently know - and don't know - about Omicron.
26/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

26/11/2021.headline: This homeless charity is changing lives, but can't keep up with surging demand
26/11/2021.description: Kids Under Cover, a charity that installs backyard studios for overcrowded struggling families, has had to pause its program because it can't meet the demand.
26/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Australia imposes travel restrictions, quarantine rules over new Omicron variant
27/11/2021.description: The federal government has announced the country's borders will be shut effective immediately to non-citizens who have been in southern Africa in the past fortnight as the Omicron variant of COVID-19 triggers a new wave of concern.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: 'Draconian': South Africa condemns rush to travel bans over Omicron variant
27/11/2021.description: The list of nations imposing travel restrictions over the new COVID-19 variant now include Australia, the United States, Brazil and Guatemala.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Three killed in Solomon Islands amid political unrest
27/11/2021.description: Police said forensic teams had launched an investigation and were still on the scene but that the cause of the deaths was unclea
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Positive COVID-19 case in NT assessed to rule out Omicron variant
27/11/2021.description: Authorities as yet have no genomic sequencing in relation to a COVID-19 case in a person who arrived on a repatriation flight from South Africa.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Victoria records 1,252 COVID-19 cases as protests continue for third weekend
27/11/2021.description: Thousands have again gathered in Melbourne's CBD to protest vaccine mandates, as Victoria records another 1,252 COVID-19 cases and five deaths.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Australia, others warn on Myanmar violence amid concern for civilians
27/11/2021.description: The governments of seven countries, including Australia, have issued a statement of concern over a military offensive in Myanmar.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Ocean wind farms on horizon for Australia as investment grows
27/11/2021.description: Offshore wind farms could soon be part of the view from some Australian beaches but climate campaigners say people should focus on the greater good.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Tributes flow as revered Broadway composer Stephen Sondheim dies aged 91
27/11/2021.description: Tributes have flowed for iconic Broadway composer and lyricist Stephen Sondheim, who passed away aged 91.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Socceroos' World Cup path now even harder after intercontinental playoff draw
27/11/2021.description: Australia face a tough path to next year's World Cup should they fail to qualify automatically, with a South American powerhouse awaiting them in a playoff.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Food and fuel shortages as calm returns to Solomon Islands after riots
27/11/2021.description: Residents in Honiara say they are concerned about the soaring cost of food and fuel as businesses that weren't burnt down during the riots reopen.
27/11/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/11/2021.headline: Josephine Baker: France's adopted black superstar immortalised
27/11/2021.description: Josephine Baker, the French-American dancer and singer who fought in the French Resistance and later battled racism, will become the first black woman to enter the Pantheon on Tuesday.
27/11/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/11/2021.headline: How a special vaccine program connected with this region's multicultural residents
27/11/2021.description: Vaccination rates in Albury-Wodonga are among the highest in the country, and one of the local multicultural communities has coverage of nearly 100 per cent. It's been put down in no small part to a special outreach program.
27/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

27/11/2021.headline: From darkness into light: Jewish Australians say Hanukkah this year comes at the perfect time
27/11/2021.description: With COVID-19 lockdowns in Australia finally lifted, life is gradually returning to normal. For Jewish people in Australia preparing to celebrate Hanukkah, the Festival of Lights has come at the right time.
27/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

27/11/2021.headline: Residents of NSW Hunter region ordered to evacuate as flood levels rise
27/11/2021.description: Residents of several parts of NSW are on alert as widespread heavy rainfall led to flooding across much of the state.
27/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Meet the man who walked 4,000 km from Perth to Sydney to raise funds for refugees
28/11/2021.description: Ivor Houston wanted to make a difference to the lives of refugees, so he packed some essentials and travelled 4,000 km from Perth to Sydney on foot. After six months, he's now home.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Omicron COVID-19 variant arrives in Australia as two cases confirmed in Sydney
28/11/2021.description: The Omicron COVID-19 variant has arrived in Australia after testing confirmed two overseas travellers who arrived in Sydney were infected with the new strai
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Push to identify migrants killed in English Channel boat tragedy as families mourn
28/11/2021.description: Grief-stricken families are mourning loved ones, and seeking answers, in the wake of a migrant boat tragedy between England and France.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: 'COVID is going nowhere': Northern Territory locks down remote community
28/11/2021.description: A remote community south of Darwin has gone into lockdown after COVID-19 was detected in its wastewater, with four new cases reported in the Northern Territory.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Barbados grapples with legacy of colonial past as it cuts ties with British monarchy
28/11/2021.description: The legacy of a colonial past and the pandemic's impact on tourism pose major challenges for Barbados as it becomes the world's newest republic.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: ‘Unmask these trolls’: Federal government announces new social media anti-bullying laws
28/11/2021.description: In a crackdown against bullying and abuse on social media, the federal government has announced new legislation to combat the anonymity of online trolls.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Israel closes its borders over Omicron as world races to contain new COVID-19 variant
28/11/2021.description: Countries across Europe have confirmed cases of the new coronavirus strain as governments worldwide began restricting travel from southern Africa.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: 'Race against time': Omicron COVID-19 variant shuts borders across the globe
28/11/2021.description: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has slammed rich Western countries for their knee-jerk imposition of travel bans following the latest Omicron coronavirus outbreak.
28/11/2021.author: Matt Dennien

28/11/2021.headline: 'It's all lies': Migrants stuck at Polish border feel cheated by people smugglers
28/11/2021.description: Migrants stuck in Belarus are finding it harder to reach the European Union, and complain of being fleeced, then abandoned by smugglers
28/11/2021.author: Matt Dennien

28/11/2021.headline: Solomon Islands residents clean riot-hit capital as Australian peacekeepers deployed
28/11/2021.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison said he was being regularly briefed about the deployment of peacekeepers in the Solomon Islands, and that while "things are very unstable, at this point there are no areas to our knowledge where there has been loss of control"
28/11/2021.author: Matt Dennien

28/11/2021.headline: 'Race against time': Omicron COVID-19 variant shuts borders across the globe
28/11/2021.description: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has slammed rich Western countries for their knee-jerk imposition of travel bans following the latest Omicron coronavirus outbreak.
28/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Concerns federal government's social media anti-bullying laws are 'unenforceable'
29/11/2021.description: The federal government's proposed laws have provided a beacon of hope for people who have advocated against online bullying, but experts say it's more complicated than Australians think.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Government asks ATAGI to review COVID-19 vaccine booster time frame in response to Omicron variant
29/11/2021.description: The federal government has called for calm after it was confirmed Omicron, a new and more transmissible COVID-19 strain, has reached Australia.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: NSW confirms four cases of Omicron as new COVID-19 variant arrives in the NT
29/11/2021.description: Two more international arrivals into NSW have been found to be infected with the Omicron COVID-19 variant, which has also been reported in the Northern Territory.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: What we know so far about Omicron, the new COVID-19 'variant of concern'
29/11/2021.description: Scientists are rapidly working to understand Omicron, the new COVID-19 variant. Here’s what we know so far.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Telcos handed stronger powers to block scam text messages
29/11/2021.description: The federal government will give telcos more power to identify and block scam texts, but says unsolicited messages sent from political parties are another matter.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Belgian backpacker's final moments heard at opening day of inquest
29/11/2021.description: Belgian teenager Theo Hayez took a dark and frightening track towards the beach the night he went missing in 2019, an inquest in the northern NSW town has heard.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Veteran suicide inquiry told of 'dark side' to military as government pledges services reform
29/11/2021.description: A royal commission has been told of a culture of torment and marginalisation in the defence forces, as the federal government said the inquiry won't delay reform of support programs for Australian veteran
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: The Omicron COVID-19 variant has sparked travel bans, but they aren't the answer to stopping it
29/11/2021.description: OPINION: Travel bans on countries detecting new variants, and the subsequent economic costs, may act as a disincentive for countries to reveal variants of concern in future.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Malawi president labels Western countries' Omicron travel bans 'Afrophobic'
29/11/2021.description: The restrictions brought in by countries including Australia are uncalled for, the president said.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Australia's reopening to visa holders delayed by two weeks to wait for more Omicron information
29/11/2021.description: The government says the move "will ensure Australia can gather the information we need to better understand the Omicron variant".
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Acclaimed actor David Dalaithngu dies aged 68
29/11/2021.description: Actor David Dalaithngu has been hailed as "one of the greatest artists Australia has ever seen".
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: The Omicron variant has been partly blamed on rich countries and vaccine inequality
29/11/2021.description: The discovery of the Omicron variant comes as developed countries such as Australia roll out booster shot programs while vaccination rates and availability in lower socio-economic nations languish.
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Jack Dorsey to step down as Twitter CEO
29/11/2021.description: Jack Dorsey has resigned as the chief executive of Twitter, posting a message to the platform that it was "finally time for me to leave".
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Australia's Solomon Islands intervention is defending a 'corrupt' government, premier says
29/11/2021.description: Malaita province premier Daniel Suidani says the presence of Australian troops is helping to protect a prime minister and "corrupt" government that don't represent the people.
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Japan joins growing list of countries to shut borders as world health ministers to discuss Omicron threat
29/11/2021.description: Japan has become the latest country to reinstate strict border controls barring all new foreign arrivals, while G7 health ministers are set to discuss the Omicron COVID-19 variant.
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: 'Standout' rise in number of Australians reporting racism as a 'very big' problem
29/11/2021.description: The latest edition of the Scanlon Foundation's annual Mapping Social Cohesion survey has found Australians continue to be supportive of immigration, but 20 per cent more now see racism as a 'very big' proble
29/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Brittany Higgins calls for 'immediate action' following report into parliamentary culture
30/11/2021.description: Brittany Higgins said she hoped "all sides of politics" would fully implement all recommendations from a damning report into workplace culture at Parliament House.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: One in three parliamentary staffers say they have faced sexual harassment
30/11/2021.description: The report by Sex Discrimination Commissioner Kate Jenkins has recommended greater gender parity and a new code of conduct for MPs and staff to change parliamentary workplace culture.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: 'Completely unacceptable': Outrage over racial profiling at Melbourne supermarket
30/11/2021.description: One of Australia's biggest grocery store chains says it has taken "corrective action" following the furore over racial profiling at a Melbourne supermarket.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Fifth Omicron COVID-19 case in NSW visited venues in Sydney and Central Coast
30/11/2021.description: NSW Health has confirmed a woman in her 30s who spent time in Sydney and the Central Coast has been infected with the new variant.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Senator accused of making 'growling' noises while Jacqui Lambie spoke
30/11/2021.description: Senators have called out another member in parliament for making disrespectful dog noises towards Jacqui Lambie as she asked a question.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: 'We have lost a titan': Tributes are pouring in for actor David Dalaithngu
30/11/2021.description: Actor David Dalaithngu has been hailed as "one of the greatest artists Australia has ever seen".
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Australia can’t keep out Omicron forever, chief medical officer says
30/11/2021.description: It comes as Tasmania announces it is closing its borders to the vast majority of overseas arrivals.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Christian Porter cleared over blind trust, but rules should change, committee says
30/11/2021.description: A parliamentary committee has found Christian Porter did not break any rules by not declaring a blind trust that paid some of his legal bills, but recommended the rules be changed.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Australians on edge as Omicron variant threatens family Christmas reunions
30/11/2021.description: Australians eager to reunite with their families over Christmas are now wracked with anxiety as the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant casts doubts over their travel plans.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Barbados cuts ties to the British monarchy to declare world's newest republic
30/11/2021.description: The move sees the end of centuries of British influence over the island nation, including more than 200 years of slavery until 1834.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison says the new Omicron COVID-19 variant won't lead to more lockdowns
30/11/2021.description: It comes as Tasmania announces it is closing its borders to the vast majority of overseas arrivals.
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

30/11/2021.headline: Why West Papuans are raising a banned independence flag across Australia
30/11/2021.description: First raised 60 years ago, the Morning Star flag is a potent symbol of the people of West Papua's long struggle for independence, and people around Australia can expect to see it raised again on 1 December
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

30/11/2021.headline: The Omicron variant was in the Netherlands at least a week before South African scientists raised the alarm
30/11/2021.description: The COVID-19 Omicron variant was detected in the Netherlands before two flights arrived from South Africa last week carrying the virus.
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

30/11/2021.headline: Booze in parliament: 'drinking culture' under microscope in major workplace review
30/11/2021.description: A review by the Sex Discrimination Commissioner Kate Jenkins has taken aim at the drinking culture at Parliament House, joining a chorus of others calling for greater regulation.
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

01/12/2021.headline: Christian Porter is quitting politics and won't recontest the next election
01/12/2021.description: The Liberal MP's announcement comes amid speculation Health Minister Greg Hunt is also planning to quit politics before the next election.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: 40 years since the AIDS epidemic began, HIV rates in Australia are at an all-time low
01/12/2021.description: Four decades since HIV/AIDS was first detected, the number of cases in Australia and outcomes for those diagnosed have drastically improved. But as with the COVID-19 pandemic, it's not the case everywhere.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Australians touch down in Fiji on the first tourist flight in 20 months
01/12/2021.description: A tourist flight from Sydney to Nadi has landed for the first time since Fiji's borders closed in March 2020.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Labor candidate calls out racist messages telling her not to contest election
01/12/2021.description: Sally Sitou says any racist comments that aim to deter her from running are “really damaging” to Chinese-Australians and all migrant communities.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Several asylum seekers have been offered bridging visas and will be released from detention
01/12/2021.description: Several asylum seekers from detention centres in Melbourne and Brisbane have been told they will be freed from detention and offered bridging visas to live in the community.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Harrowing stories lay bare the toxic workplace culture of Parliament House
01/12/2021.description: A sweeping review into parliament’s workplace culture has uncovered horrific stories of sexual harassment, bullying, sexual assault and gender inequality.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Government drops push to pass controversial voter ID bill ahead of next election
01/12/2021.description: It came after Jacqui Lambie revealed she would vote against the government's contentious bill, significantly reducing the chances of it passing the Senate.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: 'A win for reproductive choice': Northern Territory abortion law overhauled
01/12/2021.description: The legislation was passed unanimously and will prevent women from having to travel hundreds of kilometres for treatment.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Trio who allegedly escaped from the Howard Springs quarantine facility arrested
01/12/2021.description: The trio allegedly jumped the fence at the Howard Springs facility near Darwin early on Wednesda
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: A traveller who arrived in Sydney from Nigeria is 'likely' to have Omicron variant
01/12/2021.description: Initial testing indicates another overseas traveller, who recently arrived in Sydney from Nigeria, has the Omicron variant of COVID-19.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: As Barbados celebrates becoming a republic, this is what it means for Australia
01/12/2021.description: Barbados' decision to cut ties with the British monarchy has "connotations for the rest of the parliamentary monarchies” including Australia, an academic says.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: IOC has acted irresponsibly in Peng Shuai case, Sport and Rights Alliance says
01/12/2021.description: The Sport and Rights Alliance says the International Olympic Committee has acted irresponsibly and must put athletes' needs first, calling upon the organisation to use its influence to push China to investigate Peng's claims of sexual assault.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: Australia set to pass new laws that provide powers to sanction human rights abusers
01/12/2021.description: The reforms would allow the Australian government to directly target individuals or entities accused of perpetrating serious human rights violations.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: Six asylum seekers have been offered bridging visas and will be released from detention
01/12/2021.description: Asylum seekers from detention centres in Melbourne and Brisbane have been told they will be freed from detention and offered bridging visas to live in the community.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: 'Living in limbo': Exploitation, wage theft rife for temporary visa holders, report says
01/12/2021.description: Workers on temporary visas in Australia are being grossly underpaid and overworked while they struggle to secure permanent residency, according to a new report.
01/12/2021.author: None found

01/12/2021.headline: WTA suspends tennis tournaments in China over Peng Shuai case
01/12/2021.description: The Women's Tennis Association says it's suspending tournaments in China because of its concerns over the safety of Chinese player Peng Shuai.
01/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Alan Tudge stands down amid investigation into claims he was ‘abusive’ during affair
02/12/2021.description: Cabinet minister Alan Tudge says he "completely and utterly" rejects claims of abusive behaviour made by his former media adviser Rachelle Miller.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Health Minister Greg Hunt calls time on parliamentary career
02/12/2021.description: Mr Hunt, who has overseen the country's response to COVID-19, has been in parliament for two decades.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Australian doctors have made a dire prediction on bushfire deaths
02/12/2021.description: A new report, endorsed by some of the country's top medical colleges, warns the effects of climate change will place immense pressure on Australia's hospitals in the next 10 years.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Charities warn new laws will ‘stifle’ their right to political advocacy
02/12/2021.description: Groups including charities will now be forced to reveal their donors if they reach the $250,000 threshold for political spending.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Greens senator apologises over 'disgusting' slur directed at Liberal colleague
02/12/2021.description: Senator Lidia Thorpe has apologised "unreservedly" to a Liberal senator after telling her "at least I keep my legs shut" in the Senate.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Victoria has become the first state with pandemic-specific laws after controversial bill passes
02/12/2021.description: The new laws mean the premier and health minister, rather than the chief health officer, will have the power to declare a pandemic and enforce restrictions.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: How travel plans for Australian visa holders have changed due to Omicron
02/12/2021.description: Some Australian visa holders were set to arrive in Australia from 1 December, but the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant has pushed that bac
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: ‘Discriminatory’: African-Australian community leaders slam travel bans
02/12/2021.description: African-Australian community leaders have criticised the government’s decision to impose a travel ban on nine African countries after the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: The exposure of people with disability increased in 2021, but there's a long way to go
02/12/2021.description: From recent film releases to sporting triumphs at the Paralympics, there has been more celebrated exposure of people with disability this year, but advocates say misrepresentation remains a problem and outcomes for those in the community are progressing too slowly.
02/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

02/12/2021.headline: European Union imposes new sanctions on Belarus in tandem with US and Britain
02/12/2021.description: Belarus has been hit with further sanctions, with the EU accusing the nation of flying in migrants as a tactic to destabilise European states.
02/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

02/12/2021.headline: This industry is in dire need of workers - yet migrants aren't getting a look-in
02/12/2021.description: It's an industry in serious need of workers as Australia rebounds from the pandemic, yet almost half of migrants qualified in engineering can't find jobs.
02/12/2021.author: Shane Wright
